abstract.para: The &cockpit; web console allows you to create, filter, and manage virtual machines (VMs), storage pools, and networks. You can also use this interface to import existing VMs and activate, deactivate, and delete your virtualization resources.

section.title: Creating a virtual machine
section.para: To add a new virtual machine, proceed as follows:

step.para: Navigate to the Virtual machines page.
Provide the following information in the Details section

listitem.para: Select the Connection as either System or User session.

Choose an installation type from the drop-down menu: Download an OS, Cloud base image, Local install media (ISO image or distro install tree), URL (ISO image or distro install tree), or Network boot (PXE).
Select the installation source. This is unavailable if Download an OS is selected.

step.para: Define the Storage parameters, including the storage limit and memory.
To run the VM after creation, click Create and run.
To edit the VM parameters after creation, click Create and edit.
Modify the parameters and click Create and run.

section.title: Importing a virtual machine
section.para: To import a virtual machine, proceed as follows:

step.para: Navigate to the Virtual machines page and click Import VM.
In the Details section, specify the following details:

listitem.para: Enter a name for the VM.
Select the Connection as either System or User session.

note.para: Click the information icon next to Connection to view details on the available options.

listitem.para: Select the disk image located on the host file system.
Select the appropriate operating system and memory.

step.para: Define the Storage parameters, including the storage limit and memory.
To run the VM after importing, click Import and run.
To edit the VM parameters after importing, click Import and edit.
Modify the parameters and click Import and run.
